i.e. ubuntu-base, gnome etc: 'upgrade' upgrades packages that have no new dependancies. 'dist-upgrade' upgrades everything, even if it requires removing some packages due to conflicts, or pulling new deps.
Hm, right; I still don't think that a dist-upgrade updates everything. Are you saying that, say, doing a dist-upgrade will upgrade my kde packages (presuming they have no new dependencies)?
dist-upgrade will upgrade the packages even if they have new dependancies. upgrade will not.
however, sometimes packages are not able to install, based on conflicts. dist-upgrade won't fix that.
in such cases, specifying the package manually will usually generate a descriptive error that should explain the problem.
are you having problems with installing some python things?
